page.title: 14MILTONS COTT.CHALFONTSTGILES
page.content: In 1665,John Milton moved from London to Chalfont St Giles to escape the Great Plague.He was 58, already blind and having to dictate all his work to his daughter.Here he completed Paradise Lost.The cottage,500 years old,the only remaining residence of Milton,was found for him by the Quaker,Thomas Ellwood. In 1887 it was bought by the Parish and it has been made into a museum which attracts visitors from all over the world.In his time there was only a ladder to the upper floor and as he suffered from gout he probably spent all his time in the two ground floor rooms.In these two rooms are preserved many relics of his life and work,inclu- ding the manuscript of Paradise Lost and translations in many languages.On the walls are portraits of Milton.
